title: v0.12: -gui-address no longer accepts a scheme (http:// or https://)

labels.name: bug
labels.description: A problem with current functionality, as opposed to missing functionality (enhancement)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

body:
The `-gui-address` command-line parameter no longer accepts a scheme in v0.12, complains of "too many colons".

See IRC log:

```
<canton7> it seems that v0.12 doesn't like having 'http://' or 'https://' in the -gui-address command-line parameter?
<calmh> okay
<canton7> is that an intended change, or an (unintended?) artefact of something else?
<calmh> too many colons etc
<canton7> yeah
<calmh> i think unintended
<calmh> i don't remember doing something about it intentionally
<calmh> but i do remember changing how we handle overrides of those things from the command line
<calmh> so i probably broke something
<canton7> it would make my life amazing again if I can force https, even if the user hasn't checked that box in the settings (otherwise I'm playing a bit of a redirection guessing game) :D
<calmh> you can always use https anyway, you won't get a redirect to http from it
<calmh> but yes, that's supposed to work
<canton7> I vaguely recall there being a gotcha there, but can't remember what it was
<canton7> (helpful I know..)
<calmh> right
<calmh> so if that option is given, we just pretend that was the value that was stored as listen port in the config
<calmh> but we don't store it that way in the config, and we have a separate tls flag there
<calmh> so that's broken
<calmh> we shoudl chop off the scheme, like we did before
<calmh> i changed the config handling for other reasons a few commits back and broke this then
```
